meanings.definition: A sudden outburst of anger or emotion.
meanings.sent1: Her blowups at work often made her colleagues uncomfortable.
meanings.sent2: The child's blowups over small things puzzled his parents.
meanings.sent3: During the game, his blowups at the referee were quite entertaining.
meanings.sent4: His blowups were like fireworks, quick and intense.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's blowups were legendary, but always short-lived.

meanings.definition: An increase in size or intensity.
meanings.sent1: The blowups of the balloons made the party decorations more festive.
meanings.sent2: The blowups in sales figures indicated a successful marketing campaign.
meanings.sent3: The blowups in the storm's intensity caught everyone by surprise.
meanings.sent4: The blowups in the music volume got the crowd excited.
meanings.sent5: The blowups in the plot made the movie more thrilling.

meanings.definition: A photograph or image that has been enlarged.
meanings.sent1: She proudly displayed the blowups of her family photos on the wall.
meanings.sent2: The blowups of the landscapes captured every detail beautifully.
meanings.sent3: The blowups of the old pictures revealed hidden memories.
meanings.sent4: The blowups of the artwork highlighted the intricate details.
meanings.sent5: The blowups of the stars in the sky were breathtaking.

meanings.sent1: The military used blowups to clear obstacles on the battlefield.
meanings.sent2: The detective carefully examined the remnants of the blowups.
meanings.sent3: The spy planted blowups to create a distraction.
meanings.sent4: The action movie featured a thrilling scene with blowups.
meanings.sent5: The terrorist group planned to use blowups in their attack.
